item.title: Ticket #1535 (loop_start and loop_end hooks) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
This patch adds hooks to the start and end of the loop.

loop_start and loop_end

Power to the plugin makers!

NOTE: these hooks are NOT placed in the templates, but in the WP code itself... so this will work with current themes without the need to modify them.

item.title: Ticket #1533 (Wordpress deals incorrectly with the q tag with regard to subquotes) updated
item.dc:creator: Christiaan
item.description: The problem also exists for <blockquote>

item.title: Ticket #1533 (Wordpress deals incorrectly with the q tag with regard to subquotes) updated
item.dc:creator: Christiaan
item.description: Version changed

item.title: Ticket #1534 (Feature request: support for <q> element in Quicktags) created
item.dc:creator: Christiaan
item.description: We have a Quicktag for <blockquote>, and now that web browsers have better support for it can we have a Quicktag for <q>, which is the semantically correct way to publish short inline quotations?

item.title: Ticket #1533 (Wordpress deals incorrectly with the q tag with regard to subquotes) created
item.dc:creator: Christiaan
item.description:
When using the <q> element for quotemarks there is a problem doing subquotes, "as in 'this is a' subquote."

Typically a subquote would be done like this: <q>as in <q>this is a</q> subquote.</q>

But Wordpress, presumably wanting to close what it thinks are open tags, saves it like this: <q>as in </q><q>this is</q> a subquote.

So you end up with this: "as in ""this is" a subquote.

Instead of this: "as in 'this is a' subquote."

item.title: Ticket #1532 (wp_notify_postauthor() sends pingback/trackback e-mails from bad address) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
wp_notify_postauthor() sends pingback and trackback notification e-mails from wordpress@$_SERVERSERVER_NAME?

The problem is that on some hosts, $_SERVERSERVER_NAME? is in the form of www.domain.com instead of just domain.com

These wordpress@â€¦ e-mails are getting deleted somewhere along the line as obviously bogus.

We need to check for leading www. and strip it out.

item.title: Ticket #1531 (the_author filter not implemented) created
item.dc:creator: McShelby
item.description:
A filter for the_author isn't implemented. By this it is impossible to create valid RSS feeds for me because my user name contains a german umlaut and is obviously stored "as is" in the database. It's neither encoded by e.g ö nor by ö

Nevertheless the file default-filters.php also thinks such a filter is implemented cause in line 83 it tries to set this filter to

add_filter('the_author', 'ent2ncr', 8);

which would exactly do what I want to. There also may be other template tags which may have the same problem as the_author.

item.title: Ticket #1530 (Fatal error: Call to undefined function: get_header() in every theme.) updated
item.dc:creator: shrewby
item.description:
Checked many other wordpress blogs on the net. So far of 14 checked only two didn't give the error.

A quick look at any of main files in the templates you can download you'll see they start with get_header(). The files are expected to be called from the wp main directory but if you access them directly they obviously will give out an error as the function doesnt exist.

item.title: Ticket #1530 (Fatal error: Call to undefined function: get_header() in every theme.) created
item.dc:creator: shrewby
item.description:
WordPress 1.5.1.3 Strayhorn

Visit the url

www.yourwebsite.com/BLOG_DIRECTORY/wp-content/themes/THEME_DIRECTORY/

or

www.yourwebsite.com/blog/wp-content/themes/blix/page.php index.php etc.

and you get

Fatal error: Call to undefined function: get_header()

Most blogs seem to list their theme directory in the source in the css link so joe naughty user can annoy.
